alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hall and eastern Briscoe Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 338 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported penny sized hail near Quitaque associated with a strong thunderstorm located near Caprock Canyon State Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools and Brice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
